question_text: Do you consent to participate in this study?
description: Consent to participate and allow anonymised data to be published openly.
values: Allowed values: yes

question_text: What is your age?
description: Age category.

question_text: What is your gender?
description: Participant gender identity.
values: Allowed values: female; male; other; prefer_not_to_say

question_text: What best describes your primary daily activity?
description: Primary activity that best describes the participant’s typical daily role.
values: Allowed values: caregiving; other; retired; study; unemployed; work

question_text: Country of residence
description: Country participant lives in.
values: Allowed values: au; ca; ie; nz; uk; us

question_text: On average, how many hours do you spend online each day? (self-estimate)
description: Average amount of hours spent online per day
values: Allowed values: 11_12_hours; 2_4_hours; 5_6_hours; 7_8_hours; 9_10_hours; gt_12_hours; lt_2_hours

question_text: On days when you spend more than 4 hours online, how would you describe your energy afterward?
description: How participants describe their energy levels after spending more than four hours online.
values: Allowed values: energized; exhausted; neutral; tired; very_energized

question_text: What's one word that best describes how you feel after long periods online?
description: One-word description of how participants feel after long periods online.
values: Open-text responses describing participants’ feelings after long periods online. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: What's one word that describes a positive feeling you get from being online?
description: One-word description of a positive feeling participants experience from being online.
values: Open-text responses describing a positive feeling participants get from being online. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: What’s one word that best describes how you feel after regretting time spent online?
description: One-word description of how participants feel after regretting their time spent online.
values: Open-text responses describing participants’ feelings after regretting time spent online. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: How often do you regret the amount of time you spend online in a typical day?
description: Frequency with which participants regret the amount of time they spend online.
values: Allowed values: always; never; often; sometimes

question_text: Think of a moment when you regretted how you spent your time online. Which of the following activities would you have preferred to do instead? (Select up to 3)
description: Preferred alternative activities participants would have chosen instead of regretted online time.
values: Multi-select; stored as semicolon-separated snake_case tokens: aligned_with_my_values; fun_or_joyful; improve_me_for_tomorrow; improved_my_day_now; meaningful_or_purposeful; necessary_responsibilities; truly_relaxed_me

question_text: When your online activity reflects your personal values (e.g. learning, connecting with family, contributing), how does it affect your focus and energy?
description: Effect of values-aligned online activity on participants’ focus and energy.
values: Allowed values: much_less_focused; much_more_focused; somewhat_less_focused; somewhat_more_focused

question_text: When content aligns with your values (e.g. honesty, fairness, respect), how does it affect how much you trust it?
description: How value alignment influences participants’ trust in online content.
values: Allowed values: no_difference; trust_less; trust_much_less; trust_much_more; trust_somewhat_more

question_text: How often do you feel lonely or disconnected after spending time online?
description: Frequency of feeling lonely or disconnected after time spent online.
values: Allowed values: almost_always; never; often; rarely; sometimes

question_text: What’s one word that best describes how you feel about yourself after spending time on social media?
description: One-word description of how participants feel about themselves after using social media.
values: Open-text responses describing how participants feel about themselves after time spent on social media. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: How often do you question whether online content is real or trustworthy?
description: Frequency with which participants question whether online content is real or trustworthy.
values: Allowed values: almost_always; never; often; rarely; sometimes

question_text: Which types of online content do you trust the least? (select up to 2)
description: Types of online content participants trust the least.
values: Multi-select; stored as semicolon-separated snake_case tokens: emails_messages; images_photos; news; social_media; videos

question_text: What’s one word that best describes how you feel when you realise something online was false or misleading?
description: One-word description of how participants feel upon realising online content was false or misleading.
values: Open-text responses describing participants’ feelings when discovering that online content was false or misleading. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: How much does it bother you if the content you consume online isn’t created by a real person, but is generated by AI to keep you engaged or influence your decisions?
description: How much participants are bothered by AI-generated content created to influence or engage them.
values: Allowed values: extremely; moderate; not_at_all; slightly; very

question_text: If you discovered that content you were engaging with was generated by AI rather than a real person, what’s one word that best describes how you would feel?
description: One-word description of how participants would feel upon discovering content was AI-generated rather than human-created.
values: Open-text responses describing participants’ feelings if content they engaged with was generated by AI instead of a real person. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: How confident are you that you can tell the difference between human-created content and AI-generated content?
description: Participant confidence in distinguishing human-created content from AI-generated content.
values: Allowed values: extremely_confident; moderate_confident; not_confident; slightly_confident; very_confident

question_text: Do you worry that AI will make human creativity less valued?
description: Level of participant concern that AI may reduce the value placed on human creativity.
values: Allowed values: moderately; not_at_all; quite_alot; slightly; very_much

question_text: Do you trust big tech companies to use AI responsibly?
description: How much participants trust major technology companies to use AI responsibly.
values: Allowed values: moderately; not_at_all; quite_alot; slightly; very_much

question_text: How worried are you that AI will disrupt your own life (e.g., your job, studies, creativity, or relationships)?
description: Participant concern about the impact of AI on their personal life, work, or relationships.
values: Allowed values: extremely; moderately; not_at_all; slightly; very

question_text: How often do you think about the implications of AI on your daily life
description: Frequency with which participants think about AI’s effects on their daily lives.
values: Allowed values: always; never; occasionally; often; sometimes

question_text: When you’re unsure whether something online is real or trustworthy, what’s the first step you usually take?
description: Participant’s first action when uncertain about the trustworthiness of online content.
values: Allowed values: ask_friends_family; google_search; ignore; multiple_sources; share_anyway

question_text: Who do you trust most for reliable information?
description: Primary source participants rely on for trustworthy information.
values: Allowed values: academics_experts; family_friends; government; independent_creators; news; no_one

question_text: When you’re unsure whether to believe something online, what matters most in your decision?
description: Most important factor influencing participants’ decisions about whether to believe online content.
values: Allowed values: clear_facts_or_evidence; established_institutions; honesty_or_fairness; personal_instincts_or_experience; recognised_experts; trusted_people

question_text: Think of a time you weren’t sure if something online was real or trustworthy. What would you have preferred to rely on instead? (Select up to 3)
description: Preferred sources participants would rely on when unsure about the reality or trustworthiness of online content
values: Multi-select; stored as semicolon-separated snake_case tokens: aligned_with_my_values; clarity_facts_or_evidence; established_institutions; lived_experience; recognized_experts; trusted_people

question_text: When you feel overwhelmed by digital life, what’s the first thing you do to cope?
description: Participant’s primary coping strategy when feeling overwhelmed by digital life.
values: Allowed values: exercise; keep_scrolling; take_a_break; talk_to_someone; turn_off_phone

question_text: What’s one positive change digital technology or AI has brought to your life?
description: Participant-reported positive impact of digital technology or AI.
values: Open-text responses describing the positive changes digital technology or AI has brought to participants’ lives. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: If you could change one thing about your digital life to improve your wellbeing, what would it be?
description: Desired change participants believe would improve their digital wellbeing.
values: Open-text responses describing what participants would change about their digital life to improve their wellbeing. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: What’s one topic or struggle in your digital life that you would like to see us explore in a future report? Please be as specific as possible
description: Participant suggestions for future topics or struggles to be explored in upcoming reports.
values: Open-text responses suggesting topics or struggles participants would like explored in future reports. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: Free-text entries supplied when respondents selected “Other” for preferred_alternative_activities_multi
description: Free-text response supplied when participants selected “Other” for preferred alternative activities.
values: Open-text responses supplied when “Other” was selected. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: Free-text entries supplied when respondents selected “Other” for least_trusted_content_types_multi
description: Free-text response supplied when participants selected “Other” for types of online content they trust the least.
values: Open-text responses supplied when “Other” was selected. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: Free-text entries supplied when respondents selected “Other” for first_step_when_unsure_reality
description: Free-text response supplied when participants selected “Other” for their first step when unsure about online content.
values: Open-text responses supplied when “Other” was selected. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: Free-text entries supplied when respondents selected “Other” for what_matters_most_believing_content
description: Free-text response supplied when participants selected “Other” for what matters most when deciding whether to believe online content.
values: Open-text responses supplied when “Other” was selected. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: Free-text entries supplied when respondents selected “Other” for preferred_alternatives_when_unsure_multi
description: Free-text response supplied when participants selected “Other” for preferred alternatives when unsure about the reality or trustworthiness of content.
values: Open-text responses supplied when “Other” was selected. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.

question_text: Free-text entries supplied when respondents selected “Other” for coping_strategy_when_overwhelmed
description: Free-text response supplied when participants selected “Other” for their coping strategy when feeling overwhelmed by digital life
values: Open-text responses supplied when “Other” was selected. Minimal cleaning applied (whitespace trimming, newline removal). Raw wording preserved exactly. Empty string indicates no response.
